English: Everon shore, near the castle ruins
Small island northeast of Everon
I never included your report in the official documents.
How come Volkov is aware of my connection to the rebels then?
I do not know. He's probably spying on us. He has many eyes and ears in the army.\nWwho knows what else he is aware of.
We must be careful. Never underestimate your foe, Sergei, it only brings woes. Let's proceed one step at a time, starting with our mission.
What's the plan?
Attack on Everon would be easier with the rebel's support. But we did screw over them once before.
I spent some time with them. We fought together. Even if we are not friends, they will hear me out at the very least.
That is why Volkov sent you here with me, no doubt. Your French is solid, I presume?
I would say so.
You will do the talking then. Set up a meeting with them and we'll go together.
Russian! I didn't think I'd see your face again.
It's good to see you, Jean. I promised I would be back and here we are. Can we talk with Gaston?
Sure, you should talk. He's waiting in the castle. Follow me.

And so the Soviets return to our island once again. Third time's the charm as the saying goes.\nAlthough I am glad to see you alive and well, Rashiv, it still brings certain uncomfort to welcome you again inside the walls of our castle.
It's good to see you too, Gaston. This is Grigory Lemontov and we are here to offer you cooperation.\nI promised to come back and set things right. It is time to resolve this war once and for all.
You are indeed a man of your word. Tell me, does your comrade Lemontov speak French?
Why are they looking at me?
I'll handle it.
He does not. Is there something you want only me to hear?
I am going to be honest with you, Rashiv, and only you.\nWe expected you to come. Even you personally. We understand the situation and we already have an answer for you.
We know that we either help you or you will destroy us. We are not stupid.\nWe spent the last decade defending our island against two of the greatest world powers yet we are still here.

We did not get this far to simply surrender. We will help you in the invasion.\nGo straight to Malden for all we care.\nUse our airport, bases and ports. Win your war for all the good that might get you and leave.
Then we shall have peace. This is the only way for us.

I understand, Gaston. We are willing to provide you with weapons in exchange for your help and free usage of your airport.\nI am told that in the span of three months we shall leave you alone. We have no interest in the island once the Americans are gone.

We are going to be on our guard, Rashiv. If we are betrayed, we shall fight once more. We will never surrender, but this you know.\nHopefully, we can cooperate for a while and once the dust settles we shall depart in peace.

As a sign of good will, here are some documents we collected about the enemy\n - their positions, defences and such - it could prove useful to your invasion plans.\nOnce you land we shall help you fight.
You are wise, Gaston, thank you. I promise you, I will do my best to ensure we keep our end of the bargain. You have my word.
Good work, Sergei.
By the way, is Pierre not at the castle? I was hoping to meet him.
Pierre? He's dead.
Dead?

We lose men every day. This castle ruin is everything we have left. This is what I did not want to show your command, only you.\nWe are close to our last breath, Rashiv, this might be our last chance to prevail...
what was that? Jean, check the patrols! Everybody get to your posts!
You should go, Rashiv. Get the documents back to your command.
THAT MUST BE OUR CONTACT OVER THERE, BY THE FIRE.
GO BACK TO THE BOAT, SERGEI, AND GET THOSE DOCUMENTS TO KOLGUYEV. I'M GOING TO LEND THESE GUYS A HAND. OUT.
Meet the Contact
Resistance Castle
Return to the Boat
RETURN TO THE BOAT
